episodeTitle: Luffy is the Enemy! The Ultimate Zombie vs. The Straw Hat Crew
episodeTitleJapanese: 敵はルフィ！！最強ゾンビ対麦わらの一味
episodeTitleRomanized: Teki wa Rufi!! Saikyō Zonbi tai Mugiwara no Ichimi
description: The Straw Hat Pirates battle the massive zombie Oars who possesses Luffy's shadow and fighting abilities. While Luffy pursues Gecko Moria, the crew must coordinate their attacks against an overwhelmingly powerful enemy who combines giant strength with their captain's techniques.

events.title: Oars Overwhelms the Straw Hat Crew
events.description: The giant zombie Oars, possessing Luffy's shadow and fighting abilities, continues to dominate the Straw Hat Pirates. Despite their coordinated efforts, Oars' combination of massive size and Luffy's techniques proves too powerful.
events.significance: Demonstrates the severity of the threat and establishes the need for better team coordination. Shows how dangerous Luffy's abilities are when combined with Oars' enormous strength.

quotes.text: I don't know any of you! My master is Moria!
quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars rejects the Straw Hats' attempts to reach Luffy's personality within him

events.title: Sanji's Collier Frit Against Oars
events.description: Sanji attempts to appeal to the part of Oars that contains Luffy's personality, then leaps up to attack Oars with Collier Frit. However, Oars blocks the attack with his forehead, demonstrating his incredible durability.
events.significance: Shows that individual attacks are ineffective against Oars and highlights the need for teamwork. Also demonstrates Sanji's attempt to reach Luffy's consciousness within the zombie.

quotes.text: Listen, you've got to remember who you are! You're our captain!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji tries to appeal to Luffy's personality within Oars before attacking

events.title: Oars Squeezes Sanji
events.description: Oars grabs Sanji in his massive hand and begins to squeeze him. Usopp intervenes by firing a Fire Bird Star at Oars' face, causing him to drop Sanji.
events.significance: Demonstrates the life-threatening danger Oars poses and shows the crew's protective instincts working together even in desperate situations.

events.title: Usopp's Fire Bird Star
events.description: Usopp fires his Fire Bird Star technique at Oars' face when the giant zombie is squeezing Sanji. The flaming projectile hits Oars and sets him on fire briefly, forcing him to drop Sanji.
events.significance: Shows Usopp's role as a sniper providing critical support and demonstrates one of his fire-based special ammunition attacks.

events.title: Oars Recognizes Wanted Posters
events.description: Oars looks at the wanted posters on his arm and recognizes Usopp and Chopper. Usopp had hoped his face looked nothing like his wanted poster (which shows Sogeking), but Oars identifies him anyway.
events.significance: Provides comic relief while demonstrating that Oars has some of Luffy's personality traits, including his simple-minded nature. References the ongoing gag about Usopp's wanted poster showing his Sogeking alter-ego.

quotes.text: He might have a chance since his face looks nothing like the face on his wanted poster!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp hopes Oars won't recognize him because his poster shows Sogeking

events.title: Coordinated Attack on Oars
events.description: The Straw Hat crew attempts a coordinated assault. Zoro leaps at Oars but is kicked away. Franky fires at Oars, but the zombie crushes the ledge Franky and Brook are standing on. Robin uses her Spider Net technique to catch the falling crew members.
events.significance: Shows the crew's developing teamwork and Robin's crucial support role. Despite coordination, they still struggle against Oars' overwhelming power.

events.title: Robin's Cien Fleurs: Spider Net
events.description: Robin uses her Hana Hana no Mi powers to create Cien Fleurs: Spider Net (Hundred Flower: Spider Net), catching Zoro with a net made of arms after Oars kicks him high into the air. She also uses extra arms to grab and restrain Oars temporarily.
events.significance: Demonstrates Robin's versatility in both offense and defense, using her Devil Fruit powers to protect teammates while attempting to restrain the giant enemy.

events.title: Salt Ball Attempt on Oars
events.description: While Robin restrains Oars with her extra arms, Usopp seizes the opportunity to fire a salt ball into Oars' mouth, attempting to purify the zombie. However, the attempt is unsuccessful due to Oars' massive size.
events.significance: Shows the crew remembering and applying knowledge about zombie weaknesses (salt purification), though it proves ineffective against Oars' scale.

events.title: Oars Uses Gomu Gomu Techniques
events.description: Oars demonstrates his ability to use Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Mi techniques, including Gomu Gomu no Smash, Gomu Gomu no Kama (Scythe), and Gomu Gomu no Kazan (Volcano). Despite not having Devil Fruit powers himself, he can replicate the stretching motions.
events.significance: Critical reveal that Oars can mimic Luffy's fighting style and techniques due to having his shadow, making him far more dangerous than a typical zombie. This combination of giant strength and Luffy's versatile techniques creates a nearly unstoppable opponent.

events.title: Luffy Pursues Moria
events.description: Luffy continues chasing Gecko Moria through Thriller Bark, demanding that Moria fight him directly. However, Moria uses his Doppelman shadow clone and Brick Bat attacks to distract and delay Luffy while escaping.
events.significance: Shows Moria's cowardly fighting style, preferring to have others fight for him while he evades direct confrontation. This separates Luffy from his crew during their most desperate hour.

quotes.text: Get back here and fight me, Moria!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy demands a direct confrontation with Moria

events.title: Moria's Brick Bat Attack
events.description: Gecko Moria uses his Brick Bat technique, transforming his shadow into numerous bat-like projectiles that attack Luffy. The shadow bats injure Robin and knock her down when she's caught in the crossfire.
events.significance: Demonstrates Moria's Devil Fruit versatility and his willingness to harm anyone in his path. The attack shows why Moria is a Warlord despite his cowardly tactics.

events.title: Doppelman Distracts Luffy
events.description: Moria has his shadow clone Doppelman rise from Oars' shadow to distract Luffy, allowing Moria to continue fleeing. Luffy is forced to deal with the shadow duplicate instead of pursuing Moria directly.
events.significance: Shows Moria's tactical use of his shadow abilities to control the battlefield and avoid direct combat, frustrating Luffy's straightforward fighting style.

events.title: Absalom's Wedding Interrupted by Hildon
events.description: Absalom attempts to continue his forced wedding ceremony to the unconscious Nami. As the priest declares them married and Absalom leans in for a kiss, Hildon the bat zombie flies in at the wrong moment and gets kissed instead.
events.significance: Provides comic relief during the intense battle sequences. Also shows karma catching up to Absalom for his creepy behavior toward Nami.

events.title: Hildon Reports Thriller Bark's Destruction
events.description: Hildon flies to Gecko Moria to report that Oars is destroying everything on Thriller Bark in his rampage. If the destruction continues, Thriller Bark itself will be destroyed. Moria dismissively tells Hildon to fix it himself.
events.significance: Shows that Moria is willing to sacrifice his own island ship to defeat the Straw Hats, and demonstrates his callous attitude toward his subordinates. Highlights the massive scale of the Oars battle.

quotes.text: If this keeps up, Thriller Bark will be destroyed!
quotes.speaker: Hildon
quotes.context: Hildon warns Moria about the destruction Oars is causing

events.title: Straw Hats Overwhelmed by Oars
events.description: Despite their best coordinated efforts, the Straw Hat Pirates are systematically defeated by Oars. The episode ends with the wounded crew members lying on the ground as Oars stands over them, proclaiming himself a servant of Moria.
events.significance: Establishes the direness of the situation and the need for a new strategy. This is one of the rare moments where the entire crew is overwhelmed, raising the stakes for upcoming episodes.

quotes.text: I am a servant of Master Moria!
quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars proclaims his allegiance while standing over the defeated Straw Hats

quotes.text: I don't know any of you! My master is Moria!
quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars rejects the Straw Hats' attempts to reach Luffy within him

quotes.text: Listen, you've got to remember who you are! You're our captain!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji tries to appeal to Luffy's personality within Oars

quotes.text: Get back here and fight me, Moria!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy demands a direct confrontation with Moria

quotes.text: If this keeps up, Thriller Bark will be destroyed!
quotes.speaker: Hildon
quotes.context: Hildon warns Moria about Oars' rampage

quotes.text: I am a servant of Master Moria!
quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars proclaims his allegiance while standing over the defeated Straw Hats

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the importance of teamwork as the Straw Hats must coordinate their attacks against an overwhelmingly powerful enemy. Individual efforts prove insufficient.
themes.symbolism: The crew's attempts at coordinated attacks foreshadow their eventual success when they properly work together.

themes.description: The episode explores the concept of identity as Oars possesses Luffy's shadow and abilities but rejects his personality and bonds with the crew.
themes.symbolism: Oars represents a dark mirror of Luffy - all his power without his heart or bonds of friendship.

themes.theme: Perseverance in the Face of Overwhelming Odds
themes.description: Despite being outmatched, the Straw Hats continue fighting and searching for a way to defeat Oars, embodying their never-give-up spirit.
themes.symbolism: Each crew member getting back up after being knocked down represents their determination.

characterSpotlights.development: Oars demonstrates the full extent of his power by combining his massive size and strength with Luffy's fighting techniques, making him nearly unstoppable.
keyActions: Overwhelms the entire Straw Hat crew in combat
Uses Luffy's Gomu Gomu techniques despite being a zombie
Rejects attempts to reach Luffy's personality within him
Causes massive destruction across Thriller Bark
quotes: I don't know any of you! My master is Moria!
I am a servant of Master Moria!

characterSpotlights.development: Robin showcases her versatility by using her Devil Fruit powers both defensively to protect teammates and offensively to restrain Oars.
keyActions: Uses Cien Fleurs: Spider Net to catch Zoro
Restrains Oars with extra arms to create openings
Gets injured by Moria's Brick Bat attack

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji attempts to reach Luffy's consciousness within Oars, showing his faith in their captain's spirit while also fighting desperately to protect the crew.
keyActions: Appeals to Luffy's personality within Oars
Gets caught and squeezed by Oars
quotes: Listen, you've got to remember who you are! You're our captain!

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp provides crucial support with his Fire Bird Star attack and salt ball strategy, showing tactical thinking even in desperate situations.
keyActions: Saves Sanji with Fire Bird Star
Provides comic relief with wanted poster comment

characterSpotlights.development: Moria continues to demonstrate his cowardly but effective fighting style, using Doppelman and Brick Bat to avoid direct confrontation while his zombie does the fighting.
keyActions: Uses Brick Bat to attack Luffy
Dismisses concerns about Thriller Bark's destruction

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the battle sequences between Oars and the Straw Hat crew with additional choreography and individual character moments not present in the manga.
Absalom's wedding ceremony interruption by Hildon is given more comedic emphasis and screen time in the anime.

trivia.fact: Oars is voiced by Mayumi Tanaka in Japanese, the same voice actress who voices Luffy, creating a unique situation where she voices both the hero and the zombie with his shadow.
This episode marks one of the few times in the series where the entire Straw Hat crew (minus Luffy and Nami) is simultaneously defeated by a single opponent.
The opening song 'Jungle P' by 5050 was specially created for the Thriller Bark arc and ran from episodes 326-372.
Episode 365 aired during a period when One Piece episodes had no ending themes (from episode 279 to 1070), allowing for extended opening sequences.
